title: How to solve equations and inequalities involving heavy use of the absolute value function - Quora

response.answer_text: The main purpose of absolute values is in describing distance between two numbers. The absolute value of a difference, [math]|a-b|[/math], is the distance from [math]a[/math] to [math]b[/math]. The absolute value of a number, [math]|a|[/math], is the distance from [math]a[/math] to [math]0[/math]. In more general spaces, a metric is used which has similar properties, but for real or complex numbers [math]|a-b|[/math] is sufficient. So, if you see something like [math]|a-b|<\epsilon[/math], it means [math]a[/math] is within [math]\epsilon[/math] of [math]b[/math]. If you can, rather than solving equations and inequalities involving absolute values by means of algebra, try to solve them geometrically.
